TRAVEL BASEBALL

Unless you have something to show, there‚Äôs no reason to be out of town every weekend. 

Most players would be better served focusing on developing their skills, not sitting in a car for 8 hours every week.
I find that kids don't burn out on sports, they burn out on adults in sports

So how can compounding make you a millionaire? 

If you invest $500/month for 34 years, you'll have $1 million (only contributing $204k).

If you invest $1,000/month for 26 years, you'll have $1 million (only contributing $312k).

Compounding is VERY powerful.

*8% avg. return

At the HS Level almost all of you are 75-85mph with your FB. College guys are low 8‚Äôs to low/mid 9‚Äôs. I swear on everything holy that HS pitchers can win throwing 79 with command and one consistent secondary pitch you can use in any count. I promise you.

With the Tyler Anzmann Performance baseball development program, you can improve your velocity and increase your durability. Whether you elect to train in-person or remotely, we will customize a program based on your individual goals and needs. https://t.co/MNU4kGwJhT https://t.co/pqjuUqgJyX
A coach should only believe in the asymmetric upside potential of every athlete they meet.

How I like youth and HS pitchers to pitch/train during summer baseball:

1) Low innings & pitch counts. Training days are valuable. Don‚Äôt lose them to a sore arm.
2) High intent innings. Learn to trust the fastball.
3) Get stronger. (Duh)
4) Learn to sprint as fast as you can.
